summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in bumpalo 3.11.0 through opentelemetry (CVSS 9.8) causes potential use-after-free memory safety issues. The vulnerability was automatically closed as it is no longer part of the dependency inventory.
userImpact: Users may be exposed to a critical memory safety vulnerability in transitive dependencies that could lead to data corruption or application crashes.
rootCause: In bumpalo prior to 3.11.1, the lifetime of the iterator produced by Vec::into_iter() is not constrained to the lifetime of the Bump that allocated the vector's memory, causing use-after-free accesses when the Bump is dropped.
proposedFix: Upgrade bumpalo to version 3.11.1 or later
resolutionDetails: The issue was automatically closed by Mend because the vulnerable library was no longer part of the dependency inventory (likely resolved through dependency updates).
keyQuote: In bumpalo prior to 3.11.1, the lifetime of the iterator produced by Vec::into_iter() is not constrained to the lifetime of the Bump that allocated the vector's memory.
